page.title: 17THE MISSION HALL IN SHAWHEAD
page.content:
The Mission Hall was built in 1846 for the Free Church of Scotland. In 1929 the Free Church of Scotland and the Church of Scotland joined. Now the hall is used by the Church of Scotland.
The Mission Hall is for people in the village who have a long way to go to church, since the parish church is 5 miles away. There are about 25 people in the congregation. The services are on the second and third Sundays every month. Communion is twice a year in Spring and Autumn.
There is an open fire in the hall which is still used. The hall used to be lit by paraffin lamps and the hooks are still there. Part of the pulpit built in 1870 for the parish church was transferred to the hall in 1960.
